title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.56 - 57 | 4-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So the yogi he is able to be aloof from the gross body and the subtle body.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difference between the gross and subtle bodies and how a yogi can detach from both.

segments.key_quote: If I think I am the body, then my satisfaction is satisfaction of the body.
segments.summary: Using the analogy of clothing, the speaker explains how detachment from the body leads to freedom from the desire for sense gratification, which is achieved through yoga.

segments.key_quote: The conditioned soul is assaulted on all sides by maya.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how the senses constantly seek pleasure in the material world, leading to instability, and how yoga helps to withdraw from this pursuit.

segments.key_quote: Dhritarashtra by practicing the Ashtanga Yoga he had already become detached from everything material.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates how Narada advised Yudhishthira not to disturb Dhritarashtra because he had become detached through yoga and would leave his body by mystic power, burning it to ashes.
